thread.title: Golden Suns finish 5th at Ozarks Invite
thread.title_full: Golden Suns finish 5th at Ozarks Invite

author: ATU Athletic Communications (noreply@couriernews.com)
title: Golden Suns finish 5th at Ozarks Invite
text: Golden Suns finish 5th at Ozarks Invite by ATU Athletic Communications The Courier Your Messenger For The River Valley 08:39 AM, Tuesday, October 13 2015 | 87 views | 0 | 0 | | CLARKSVILLE — The Arkansas Tech cross country team placed three runners in the top 20 and finished fifth as a team at the Ozarks Invitational in Clarksville on Saturday.“There’s been improvements,” head coach Tom Aspel said. “We just need to get back and train a little harder.”Mary Simmons paced the Golden Suns with an 11th place finish, closing out the race in 19:55.9.“We all had to run hard, it was a tough course,” Simmons said. “It wasn’t my best time, but I’m proud of it and I’m going to work to get faster.”Logan Edwards also closed out with a top 20 finish, crossing the finish line in 20:28.5 for 17th place and Shannon McLaughlin finished right behind her with a time of 20:31.6.Maria Valente just missed out on a top 20 finish by 0.8 seconds, finishing in 21st with a 20:39.8.Afia Abdus Samad crossed the finish line in 21:32.5 to finish the race in 37th.“I think they ran kind of well,” head coach Tom Aspel said. “I think we need to mentally toughen up a lot more. We just need to pull our socks up and run a little tougher and I think that will come the next week and the week after.”The Golden Suns’ next meet will be at the University of Arkansas-Little Rock Invitational next Saturday with the race slated 8 a.m. start.
